descript.abstract: The Horizon Pores table lists the voids for the referenced horizon. If the Quantity is greater than zero (low=2, RV=5, high=10) in a row, the voids in that row exist everywhere the horizon and component occur in the map unit. If the Quantity includes zero (low=0, RV=2, high=5), the voids may exist in some places, but not in others. More than one row can be marked as an RV row because a horizon may have more than one size or shape of void.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

attr.attrdef: The number of a selected size of pores per unit area of undisturbed soils.
The number of a selected size of pores per unit area of undisturbed soils.
A yes/no field that indicates if the pores described are representative for the horizon.
The unique identifier of a record in the Horizon table. Use this column to join the Horizon Pores table to the Horizon table.
A description of the multiaxial shape of the pore.
The number of a selected size of pores per unit area of undisturbed soils.
The average diameter of a pore. (SSM)

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Horizon Pores table.
Average vertical distance through which the minimum diameter of the pore exceeds 0.5mm when the soil layer is moist or wetter.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
